Key Arguments: The legislation risks turning Australia into a dictatorship rather than a democracy.
It places too much power and responsibility on a single group (ACMA), which cannot be expected to be unbiased or infallible.
The bill threatens freedom of speech by potentially punishing individuals for expressing their opinions.
The proposed measures are seen as dangerous and unjustifiable.
Main Themes: Potential for Bias and Abuse of Power
Notable Quotes: Do we want to live in a democratic Australia or a dictatorship?

To believe that any group of people can be totally unbiased in their decision making, as well as being infallible in their judgement a hundred percent of the time is clearly unrealistic and frankly impossible.
The bill is dangerous and unjustifiable.
